title.value: Delete data on hard discs using the Alternate iso-CD

body.value:
Very old laptops can only be booted using the alternate CD of Lubuntu to install. But the alternate CD does not contain the shred-order (shell) to delete the data on hard discs. As the reload of this shell order is complex during the installation we recommend a different solution.
Use an alternative distribution available in your country, e.g.
Parted Magic - CD
Knoppix-CD (http://www.knoppix.org/) oder
a Rescue CD (http://ubuntu-rescue-remix.org/)
Start these Live-CDs and you are able to use the shred order on the terminal level.
Alternatively, you can re-install shred during the Lubuntu installation using this command:
press at the same time Strg/CTL + Alt + F3, e.g. when asked to .... (to be added)
Type --> apt-get install coreutils (Enter)
shred /dev/sda -v -f (Enter)
press Strg/CTL + Alt + F7 at the same time to return to installation process
